messages.message: A couple of our new engineers (like @AD) are already getting the latest M1 chip MBP :slightly_smiling_face: We are currently trying to get Instabase running locally on M1 laptops, we ran into some problems and solved some problems. I’m starting this thread for anyone who is setting things up on a M1 laptop to connect and discuss things together. After we get the environment running fully we’ll update the onboarding doc to include any changes.
cc @Heymian - I know you already tried out some stuff :smile: would be great if you can share here what you did! @Naveen and Amardeep are looking at this together now
it won’t come up yet until we get around to looking into the couple of things I called out on our engineering leads channel. Most critical is we need someone to look into the node version upgrade.
Not being able to bring up server-nginx is the biggest blocker.
I've been running my local dev server on node 14 for the last 2 months or so and have seemed ok. I can look into upgrading node
That'd be great Eric!! Actually I'm going to set up a short sync with you, me, and @John St since he's the only one who's done it before
If you need an M1 to test on, you can reach out to IT to get one!

Also, to caveat my testing. since i don’t really understand the node build, it could very well be I messed up somewhere, but i tried to follow our normal set up instructions for node 12 and nginx spat out a lot of garbage. i’ll attach the dump
okay - we need to upgrade anyways because I think support is ending in aprilish, so might as well upgrade now!
hey @Heymian - does nginx fail for JS build or at runtime?
don’t remember, my M1 is out of power. but logs here

Looks like upgrading node-sass to v7.0.1 clears the compile errors, at least in my limited run. The older version doesn't support node 17, which the logs say was being used by gyp (and brew installed on my M1 too). I haven't tried with an older node (will install nvm..) but it sounds like that works from your comment, @Eric Han.

https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/23829 Here is the PR. The updated jenkins tag is from running
`make push-docker` from `/Users/erichan/instabase/tools/releasetools/jenkins/Makefile` I’ve never done this before so please let me know if I should change the tag another way. (the image is still pushing at the time of post) cc:@Heymian @Jessica
Amazing, thanks for getting this out quickly
